DataElement.preferredName: LARS Score 5 V1 Have Urge to Open Bowels Strong Enough to Cause Rush to Toilet Score 3 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person's stated response of whether they have ever had strong urge to open their bowels that they rushed to the toilet, using a 3 point scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Lower Anterior Resection Syndrome Score Have Urge to Open Bowels Strong Enough to Cause Rush to Toilet Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized six-item questionnaire developed by Emmertsen et al. in 2012 that utilizes three- and four-point rating scales to assess bowel dysfunction following a low anterior resection for rectal cancer.:A question about whether an individual has or had such a strong urge for a bowel movement that they have to rush to the toilet._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standardized six-item questionnaire developed by Emmertsen et al. in 2012 that utilizes three- and four-point rating scales to assess bowel dysfunction following a low anterior resection for rectal cancer.

Concepts.definition: A standardized five-item questionnaire developed by Emmertsen et al. in 2012 that utilizes three- and four-point rating scales to assess bowel dysfunction following a low anterior resection for rectal cancer.

Property.preferredName: Have Urge to Open Bowels Strong Enough to Cause Rush to Toilet Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A question about whether an individual has or had such a strong urge for a bowel movement that they have to rush to the toilet._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.longName: Have Urge to Open Bowels Strong Enough to Cause Rush to Toilet
Concepts.definition: A question about whether an individual has or had such a strong urge for a bowel movement that they have to rush to the toilet.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Lower Anterior Resection Syndrome Score Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A standardized six-item questionnaire developed by Emmertsen et al. in 2012 that utilizes three- and four-point rating scales to assess bowel dysfunction following a low anterior resection for rectal cancer._An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).

Concepts.definition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).

PermissibleValues.value: Yes, less than once per week

An indication that something occurs or occurred less than once a week.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Do you ever have such a strong urge to open your bowels that you have to rush to the toilet?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.
